data: PED NEPH AMB Hemodialysis Intradialytic Complication Management (Module)
If temperature 38 DegC then order blood culture X 2 STAT, CBC and C&S swab of suspected site
If/when fever or chills post initiating dialysis or water contamination is suspected, then order C&S dialysate inflow and outflow and of water source
If O2 saturation less than 90% SpO2
If/when productive cough, then order sputum C&S
Symptoms of muscle weakness, twitching or paresthesias
If/when signs of muscle weakness, twitching or paresthesias, then order potassium level, calcium ionized serum and notify provider
If POC blood glucose greater than 22 mmol/L
If/when diarrhea for 2 days or more, then order stool C&S, Clostridium difficile toxin stool, potassium level and notify provider
If patient has bloody stools or temperature 38 DegC or more
If vascular access clotted or unable to use for hemodialysis, order CBC, INR, PTT and electrolytes panel STAT
If vascular access appears infected (reddened, inflamed, exudates present) for hemodialysis, order blood culture X 2 and C&S swab of suspected site
If/when history of acute blood loss from any source (e.g. nose bleed or GI bleed), then initiate heparin free dialysis and notify provider
If/when intradialytic hypotension, then follow hypotension protocol
If/when potassium bloodwork indicates a change in dialysate bath is required, then follow institutional potassium guideline for chronic hemodialysis patients
